title: How long was Vinnie Jones married and how did his wife die?
text:
Vinnie and his wife Tanya were together for decades… (Pictures: Getty)

In a few short hours, former footballer Vinnie Jones will be making his X Factor Celebrity debut.

As a tribute to his late wife Tanya, who died earlier this year, Vinnie will be singing her favourite songs on the show.

He has also vowed to donate any winnings he might earn from X Factor: Celebrity to Harefield Hospital and Cedars Sinai, which were hospitals that cared for Tanya.

As we wait to see how his live performance goes, here’s a quick look at Vinnie and his wife’s time together.

How long was Vinnie Jones married to his late wife?

Vinnie and Tanya were married in 1994 until her death in July 2019.

That adds up to a total of 25 years.

Tanya is survived by her husband and two grown children: Kaley Jay Terry and Aaron Elliston Jones.

Kaley is Tanya’s child from her first marriage with footballer Steve Terry, however Vinnie went on to adopt her, and often refers to her as ‘my daughter’.

Vinnie and Tanya when they were younger (Picture: David Crump/Daily Mail/REX)

Tayna was 53 years old when she died after a six-year-long battle with cancer.

According to Vinnie’s spokesperson, she passed away surrounded by her family.

Vinnie, 54, previously recalled that one day he woke up to the sound of his wife coughing. He told The Mirror: ‘We knew it was the end, we were cuddling her. I kissed her a lot and told her I loved her.

Vinnie and Tanya in recent years (Picture: Rex Features)

‘I kept saying: “I love you, I love you.”’

‘I just feel now, I’m content with crashing my way through the last 10, 20, 30 years of my life in God’s waiting room, in Tanya’s waiting room,’ the former footballer added.

Tanya had been treated for cervical cancer twice and she later was diagnosed with malignant melanoma, the most serious form of skin cancer.

Vinnie confirmed in 2013 that both he and Tanya were battling skin cancer.

‘She has dealt with health issues every day since,’ he said, sharing that Tanya’s cancer was believed to be the result of drugs she took following a heart transplant 26 years ago.

He added: ‘When it comes to things like this, women are stronger. Suddenly I’ve gone from the one helping her to the one that needs support. I’m trying to take the world in a bit more and appreciate my family and friends.’

X Factor: Celebrity continues on Saturday on ITV.
